author: Oanh Ngo Usadi
title: A Candy From Mars and Americaâ€™s Sweetness
text:
In the early 1980s, my family would gather at night around our battery-powered shortwave radio, listening to Voice of America. Back then I knew the broadcast only by its acronym, VOA, which I assumed was a Vietnamese word. Inside our thatched hut among rice paddies of the Mekong Delta, the radio delivered forbidden news of a world beyond Vietnam.
I was 11, and America captured my imagination. My three siblings who escaped Vietnam a year earlier had just been accepted into the U.S. But more important in my young mind, America...
